sentences.cn: 他开始在学术上超越他人。

sentences.en: After the curriculum arrangement is completed, it is exported to the Excel file.
sentences.cn: 使用排课系统把课表排好以后, 把课表导出到Excel电子表格文件.

sentences.en: As with visual feedback, computer games tend to excel at positive audio feedback.
sentences.cn: 和视觉反馈一样, 计算机游戏擅长于正面听觉反馈.

sentences.en: For pickling , preserving, and cookery, none could excel her.
sentences.cn: 若是制酸菜 、 腌腊蜜饯、烹调, 无人能做得超过她.

sentences.en: Hamlet and Laertes were known to excel at this sword play.
sentences.cn: 哈姆莱特和雷欧提斯两个人都精通剑术.

sentences.en: He almost burst with pride when his son John began to excel at football.
sentences.cn: 当儿子约翰在足球方面表现优秀时，他心中充满了自豪。

sentences.en: He is working hard to excel his predecessors.
sentences.cn: 他正努力超越他的前任.

sentences.en: How can I read a Microsoft Excel file on a computer that only has Works installed?
sentences.cn: 我怎样在只安装了Works软件的电脑上读取微软的Excel文件呢？

sentences.en: I am a good shot, but even in this he learnt to excel me.
sentences.cn: 我的枪法很准, 但即使在这方面,他也胜过了我.

sentences.en: If your talent combines with diligence, you can excel in your pursuit.
sentences.cn: 如果你把天赋与勤奋结合起来, 你所追求的事业便会出类拔萃.

sentences.en: Mary was a better rider than either of them and she excelled at outdoor sports.
sentences.cn: 玛丽比他们俩骑得都好，她擅长户外运动。

sentences.en: Rick has always excelled at foreign languages.
Skilled accounting software and Excel, strong team leadership and communication skills.
sentences.cn: 熟练掌握财务软件,Excel, 有较强的团队领导力,沟通能力强.

sentences.en: The model tool made by EXCEL, like chinese copybook.
sentences.cn: 这个模版是用EXCEL做成的, 比较像中国的字帖.

sentences.en: The paper introduces the method to draw physics graphs using Excel software.
sentences.cn: 介绍了用Excel软件绘制物理图像的方法.

sentences.en: The result is that most workers still feel little motivation to excel.
sentences.cn: 其结果是,大多数工人依然缺乏应有的劳动热情.

sentences.en: You excel so much in the dance, Miss Eliza.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎小姐, 你跳舞跳得那么高明.

sentences.en: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.cn: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

phrases.tran_cn: v. 在……方面胜过；在……方面很擅长

trans.tran_en: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people
